item.title: Covid-19: Next two weeks 'crucial' for ending England lockdown
item.description: People in England must not become complacent due to a potential vaccine, a government scientist says.

item.title: Dominic Cummings and Lee Cain: Exits give chance to 'reset government'
item.description: Senior Tory MP David Davis says PM Boris Johnson has taken "decisive action" over his top aide.

item.title: Million MAGA March: Thousands of pro-Trump protesters rally in Washington DC
item.description: Supporters swarm the presidential motorcade as Mr Trump drives past on his way to his golf course.

item.title: Coronavirus: Austria locks down as new wave grips Europe
item.description: Austrians are urged not to meet people from outside their households as hospitals feel the pressure.

item.title: Covid: Romania hospital blaze kills at least 10 infected patients
item.description: At least 10 die as oxygen used to treat the patients helps spread the fire in Piatra Neamt.

item.title: Felixstowe Port in 'chaos' as Christmas and Brexit loom
item.description: One shipping firm has re-routed to Rotterdam to avoid "unacceptable" congestion at Felixstowe Port.

item.title: Prince Charles to urge UK and Germany to 'reaffirm bond'
item.description: The prince will be first Royal Family member to attend an annual remembrance service in Berlin.

item.title: Covid: Leicester's lockdown Diwali 'is like our Christmas gone'
item.description: Leicester's Golden Mile is usually buzzing for the festival but things are very different this year.

item.title: Falkland islanders celebrate being landmine free - after nearly 40 years
item.description: Removing the last landmine on the Falkland Islands is a "momentous change", says islander Barry Elsby.

item.title: Ethiopia Tigray crisis: Conflict worsens as airports attacked
item.description: Forces in the northern state of Tigray admit firing rockets at two airports in a neighbouring region.

item.title: Titanic letter by 'brave' pastor John Harper sells for £42k
item.description: Preacher John Harper refused a seat in a lifeboat and gave his lifejacket to another passenger who survived.

item.title: Phillip Cocu: Derby part company with manager with club bottom of Championship
item.description: Derby County part company with manager Phillip Cocu with the club bottom of the Championship.

item.title: England 40-0 Georgia: Jamie George scores hat-trick in six-try victory
item.description: Hooker Jamie George's hat-trick helps England to a comfortable six-try victory against Georgia in their first match at Twickenham since March.

item.title: In pictures: Diwali celebrations around the world
item.description: The festival of light is celebrated with candles and fireworks by Hindus, Sikhs and Jains worldwide.

item.title: The secret relationship destroyed by war
item.description: Cousins Mehdi and Melek kept their relationship secret – then war brought it to a sudden end.

item.title: The small shops in battle with the retail giants
item.description: Efforts to shop local this Christmas could give small businesses a fairy tale end to a grim year.

item.title: Week in pictures: 7 - 13 November 2020
item.description: A selection of striking images taken around the world this week.

item.title: Children in Need: Audience-free show raises £37m
item.description: Host Mel Giedroyc says despite this year's challenges due to coronavirus, "we are strong".

item.title: Children in Need highlights: Joe Wicks and Murray v Crouch
item.description: More than £37m has been raised for the charity.

item.title: Covid: India's festival season doesn't stop for coronavirus
item.description: Millions of people are marking the festival of Diwali, but there are concerns over rising coronavirus cases.

item.title: Christmas decorations fan aims to make people smile
item.description: Paul Fenning says the decorations in his Christmas spectacle are needed more than ever this year.

item.title: How critical is the weather for the SpaceX launch?
item.description: Nasa and SpaceX were due to send astronauts to the ISS on Saturday but the weather's changed their plans.

item.title: 2000: The US election decided by the courts
item.description: The story of one of the closest and most contested elections in US history

item.title: Is this giant alligator on a Florida golf course real?
item.description: Many people have been questioning this viral reptile video. So we asked a gator expert to weigh in.

item.title: Doug Emhoff: The first 'second dude' in the White House
item.description: By way of Kamala Harris's historic candidacy her husband will also be breaking barriers.

item.title: US Election 2020: The 'dead voters' in Michigan who are still alive
item.description: Trump supporters are making allegations of dead people voting. Is there any evidence?

item.title: Social media: How can we protect its youngest users?
item.description: A psychologist says parents need to provide their children with "digital resilience".

item.title: How North Korea is trying to tackle smoking
item.description: The habit is common and Kim Jong-un is often seen with a cigarette in hand at public appearances.

item.title: Yorkshire Ripper: The hunt to catch a killer
item.description: Peter Sutcliffe was finally brought to justice in 1981, six years after he committed his first murder.

item.title: Nagorno-Karabakh: The families burning down their own homes
item.description: Fleeing ethnic Armenians are destroying their own homes so no Azerbaijanis can move in.

item.title: Do these Republican voters accept election result?
item.description: Some 70% of Trump supporters say the election "free and fair" and are struggling to come to terms with the result.

item.title: Birmingham violence: The three teenagers killed days apart
item.description: In the space of 12 days in February 2019, three teenagers were fatally stabbed in Birmingham.

item.title: Covid bereavement: Call for greater support for those left behind
item.description: Families who have lost loved ones to coronavirus want better access to bereavement counselling.

item.title: Scotland earn comeback victory in Italy
item.description: Scotland recovered from a slow start to beat Italy 28-17 in their Autumn Nations Cup opener and earn a fifth win in a row.

item.title: Hamilton prepares for history in unpredictable times
item.description: Even if the Turkish Grand Prix does not witness history on Sunday, it looks likely to be exciting.

item.title: Man Utd come from 2-0 down to draw with Man City - report & highlights
item.description: Manchester United come from two goals down to save their unbeaten record against rivals Manchester City in the Women's Super League.

item.title: The Masters 2020: Bernhard Langer sinks 63-foot birdie putt at Augusta
item.description: Two-time former Masters champion Bernhard Langer, who is 63 years-old, sinks a 63-foot birdie putt on the 16th green during his third round at Augusta.

item.title: WSL: US star Tobin Heath hits 'stunner' in Manchester derby
item.description: Watch as Manchester United's Tobin Heath scores a stunning goal in their 2-2 draw with Manchester City.

item.title: Covid: What are the rules for winter holidays and going abroad?
item.description: International travel is very restricted at the moment, but a potential vaccine has boosted hopes.

item.title: Coronavirus: What is a recession and how could it affect me?
item.description: The UK recession is over but the economy is not actually doing that well, so what does it all mean?

item.title: Covid: The new lockdown rules for England, Wales, Scotland and Northern Ireland
item.description: Northern Ireland has extended its restrictions, while Wales, England and Scotland also have rules in place.

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in your area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: Covid symptoms: What are they and how do I protect myself?
item.description: A new cough, fever and change in smell or taste are the key symptoms that mean you may have coronavirus.

item.title: Is the Covid vaccine safe for me? And other questions
item.description: We answer some of your questions about the Pfizer vaccine for coronavirus.

item.title: Coronavirus: What is the R number and how is it calculated?
item.description: The simple but crucial number at the heart of lockdown decisions across the UK.

item.title: Lockdown rules: What are the Covid regulations where you live?
item.description: Use our search tool to find out about coronavirus rules and restrictions where you live.

item.title: Covid: Nine ways England's lockdown is different from last time
item.description: There's a familiar feeling as England returns to lockdown, but many rules have changed.

item.title: How do I find a new job during Covid and which sectors are hiring?
item.description: Jobseekers are having a tough time at the moment, but support is available.

item.title: Covid: Why is coronavirus such a threat?
item.description: Why does the biology of coronavirus mean it poses such a threat to human life?

item.title: Covid: What are the quarantine rules when arriving in the UK?
item.description: Travellers arriving from almost all other countries must self-isolate on entry to the UK.

item.title: Five Covid numbers to watch: Is Scotland turning a corner?
item.description: The rate of new coronavirus cases appears to be slowing, but there are big variations in different parts of the country.

item.title: Covid: What's happening with next year's exams?
item.description: Schools are adopting measures to reduce the spread of coronavirus and keep pupils safe.

item.title: Coronavirus: How are weddings working around the UK?
item.description: Weddings are currently banned in England and have varying rules in the rest of the UK.

item.title: Covid symptoms: Is it a cold, flu or coronavirus?
item.description: With similar symptoms, deciding whether or not you need to get tested for coronavirus can be tricky.

item.title: Covid: How will university students go home for Christmas?
item.description: Students in England and Wales are being asked to travel home early after being tested for coronavirus.

item.title: Covid-19 pandemic: Tracking the global coronavirus outbreak
item.description: Key charts and maps explaining how the virus has spread around the world.

item.title: Covid: Can I go on furlough and how much will I be paid?
item.description: More people are now eligible for furlough, with the scheme extended until March 2021.

item.title: Covid: Who will have the Pfizer vaccine first and when can I get it?
item.description: A vaccine for Covid-19 is set to be put forward for emergency approval.

item.title: Unemployment rate: How many people are out of work?
item.description: The unemployment rate is rising as Covid hits different parts of the economy.

item.title: Covid: What is mass testing and how does it work?
item.description: Liverpool has the UK's first mass Covid testing pilot, with Nottinghamshire and others to follow.

item.title: Covid: What help is available to pay my bills?
item.description: Mortgage and rent holidays, help with debts, and cutting energy and insurance bills are all possible.

item.title: Coronavirus: How soon can we expect a working vaccine?
item.description: If scientists succeed in making a coronavirus vaccine, when will we get it, how much will it cost and who will get it first?

item.title: Covid: How Marcus Rashford campaign changed free school meals
item.description: England's voucher scheme does not cover school holidays, unlike those elsewhere in the UK.

item.title: Covid: How close are we to a vaccine?
item.description: Hopes are rising that an effective vaccine against Covid-19 will be available soon.

item.title: Covid: How to survive a winter lockdown, from those who've done it
item.description: Tips on lockdown life in cold weather - from sub-zero coffee meet-ups to watching films in the bath.

item.title: Coronavirus: What are the rules for face masks or face coverings?
item.description: People around the UK must now wear face coverings in many public places, but what are the rules?

item.title: I'm A Celebrity: Castle owner 'thought ITV email was spam'
item.description: Mark Baker, who founded the Gwrych Castle Preservation Trust, ignored ITV's proposal at first.

item.title: Wild Mountain Thyme: Is an Irish accent the hardest to master?
item.description: The accents in Wild Mountain Thyme, starring Jamie Dornan and Emily Blunt, raise eyebrows in Ireland.

item.title: 'We met through MoneySavingExpert'
item.description: Laura Hawcroft from Manchester takes us through her week during the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Minehead residents nickname visiting grey seal 'Jeff'
item.description: A wildlife expert says the seal could be recharging his batteries in the Somerset resort.

item.title: A1 Scotch Corner: Cauliflowers strewn across road as lorry overturns
item.description: The vegetables were strewn across the A66 where it meets the A1 at Scotch Corner, North Yorkshire.
